featured.text: No doubt his ability to listen contributed (28) his capacity to write.
He had no reason to doubt it.

None of them wanted to—though for some years afterwards I was left in no doubt that I was morally obliged to them, in the sense that it always seemed to be my round when it came to the buying of drinks.
There is no doubt that A.…can you succeed in achieving your goal.
all the doubts about his ability to play on our school basketball team.

definition.zh_def: 懷疑；不確定的情況或狀態
definition.en_def: A feeling of uncertainty or lack of conviction.
definition.example: She had a doubt about the accuracy of the report.
